title: Franz Barten
text:
Franz Barten (26 January 1912 – 4 August 1944) was a <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a> <a href="fighter%20ace">fighter ace</a> from <a href="Germany">Germany</a>. He was born on 26 January 1912 at <a href="Saarbr%C3%BCcken">Saarbrücken</a>. Barten was credited with having shot down a total of 55 <a href="Allies%20of%20World%20War%20II">Allied</a> aircraft.
On 4 August 1944, Barten was shot down in a <a href="Messerschmitt%20Bf%20109">Messerschmitt Bf 109</a> in aerial combat with <a href="P-47%20Thunderbolt">P-47 Thunderbolt</a> belonging to the <a href="United%20States%20Army%20Air%20Forces">United States Army Air Forces</a> near Rheinsehlen. He bailed out of his aircraft, but was shot while hanging in his parachute.
